did.head: Descriptive Summary

did.unittitle: Wood blocks, Prints, and Letters of Julius J. Lankes, December 1920-1987
did.physdesc: This collection consists of two letters with their envelopes.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Reproduction restricted. Contact Manuscripts Curator for terms.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Julius J. Lankes, Wood Blocks, Prints, and Letters, 1920-1987, Accession #10164-j through 10164-n, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased by the Library from Thomas G. Boss Fine Books, Boston, Massachusetts, on July 20, 1990.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: These letters were removed from a copy of J.J. Lankes: Painter Graver on Wood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two letters from J.J. Lankes to Richard E. Fiscus, Buffalo, New York, with their envelopes. The earliest, December 27, 1920, discusses the cost of ordering and producing a bookplate based upon the amount of work required and the design.

In the second letter, January 6, 1921, Lankes offers to "fix up a print of the Philosopher adding Ex-libris and your name and have a zinc etching made for about $ 20.OO," or to do one entirely in wood for about twice that amount. The second letter includes a tiny sketch of the proposed bookplate. Also included is an example of a Lankes bookplate with a farmhouse and snow scene dated [1921 ?].
